alert.note: Alert for Alleghany (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of Alleghany County in west central Virginia, southern Greenbrier, Summers, northern Mercer and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia, and the City of Covington through 1000 AM EST... At 900 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along the Interstate 64 corridor between Covington, Virginia, and Beckley, West Virginia. These storms were moving to the east, and were producing heavy downpours of rain. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall of one inch an hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Rain may flood roadside ditches and wash debris onto the highway. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Covington... Clifton Forge... Lewisburg... Hinton... White Sulphur Springs... and Ronceverte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
